headline: Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie
description: These chewy chocolate chip cookies are big, fat, and delicious. Make your own bakery-style, soft chocolate chip cookies with this easy recipe.

video.description: See how to make chewy, bakery-style cookies.
video.name: Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie

name: Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper.
Sift flour, baking soda, and salt together; set aside.

Beat brown sugar, melted butter, and white sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in egg, egg yolk, and vanilla until light and creamy; add flour mixture and stir until dough is just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough 3 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 15 to 17 minutes. Cool on the cookie sheets briefly before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely perfect and actually stayed moist and chewy all week long to enjoy! I made the recipe exactly the way it was written!
These cookies came out great. Make sure you use less chocolate chips though, I had some leftover. Other than that, I would give it 4.9 stars.
I have made these SO MANY TIMES! But I replace one cup of butterscotch chips and OMG! AMAZIZNG!!!!
this recipe was amazing, The best one i have had
OML these are the best cookies I think I have ever made. TIP - cook them EXACTLY as the recipe says, nothing different.
If I could give this recipe more stars I would. When I want to make someone feel special. I make a batch.

This is my go to recipe! Perfect every sing time, I‚Äôve used just the base and added other things besides chocolate chips, like butterscotch chips and heath toffee bits, perfect no matter what! If it doesn‚Äôt come out for you, you did something wrong.
Great recipe! You must double the ingredients if you want to make more than 18 cookies.
Just what I wanted a BIG COOKIE. Delicious Thanks Allrecipes, üòã.

All I can say is WOWZERS!! Listen, I didn‚Äôt trust the recipe at all because of the melted butter and considerable amount of vanilla in the recipe. I decided to give it a shot because I wanted a thicker cookie and my current recipe was just not hearty enough. I am now a believer. I followed the recipe to the letter and they came out perfectly!!! So happy. I am going to do a batch with nuts and probably reduce the chips a bit (right?). Thanks for this recipe - I am SOLD!
it was a great the cookies where very chewy i love them!
Very good! I tried with a fork and a whisk. They didn't turn out light and fluffy. So I suggest using the mixer. Don't use bitter cholate. Read the comment BEFORE making, and follow.

A great recipe, but way too many chocolate chips. I put in 1 cup chocolate chips and a cup of nut pieces. It still seems like a lot of chocolate chips even at only 1 cup. I find the batter is easier to work with if refrigerated for an hour, but the cold batter will add 60 - 90 seconds of bake time. I use a slightly rounded ice cream scoop to measure out and get 23 - 24 cookies, 8 to a pan.
Tasted like heaven in a cookie

It is currently in the oven right now, but please make sure you do not put in 2 cups of chocolate chips. There was too many that they would start falling out of the dough. I would recommend you put in 1 1/2 cups or something close to that.
This is the best chocolate chip cookie recipe iv ever made people at work what me to sell them ‚ù§
Followed recipe , but took advice from one of comments and cooled the dough before baking . I also wrapped dough in two long rolls of parchment paper so I could slice into equal size cookies.

Honestly such good cookies!! Its also easy to make, but make sure not to over mix if you're a beginner. Also speaking, kneed the cookie dough into smaller balls, because they spread like crazy. P.S Vannila can flare up the flavour, so I use a tad bit more.. ü§©üôè
Very good!
This is my go to recipe.
Came out fantastic. I added 1 cup Milk Chocolate Chips and 1 cup of Reese's Peanut Butter Chips.

I made this many times, it really is the best of the best. I did make one change, after making it the first time I added an additional 1/4 cup of flour. They come out perfect every time. You don‚Äôt have to chill them before baking them. The melted butter is way easier to work with. Just follow the recipe, you won‚Äôt be disappointed, honestly.
I got so many compliments on these cookies. They were perfect and stayed soft.
Excellent flavor and texture. A smash hit at the party!!
I have been making these for my grandson for 16 years! They are the BEST!
lovely texture but far too sweet

I have been looking for a soft, chewy chocolate chip cookie recipe and this is it! My 10 year old granddaughter took on bite and said, "This is the best chocolate chip cookie I've ever had." From the mouths of babes...
Best chocolate chip cookie EVER!
My son (9) loves to cook and bake with me. Easy to follow directions and turned out so yummy! We followed the directions exactly and wouldn't change a thing
They are really soft and chewy. Delicious!

I don‚Äôt know what I was thinking. I melted the chocolate chips and then realized I wasn‚Äôt supposed to. So I just went with them being melted. Best mistake I made! These were absolutely delicious. I followed the previous reviewers advise and sprinkled them with sea salt when I pulled them out of the oven. Great recipe!

Great soft chocolatey cookies, just the way we like them. Thanks to melted butter this recipe is quick & easy. I didn't grease my sheets and cookies came out just fine. Also reduced choc chips to 1.5 cups, mixed milk and semisweet chips too. I might add sprinkling of salt to tops during cool time.
they where good but chewy
Great instructions. Followed them exactly and made perfect chewy chocolate chip cookies. Saving this recipe!

This was the best CCC recipe I have ever made, and my husband agrees. I did make some additions as follows: I added 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla beans, along with the vanilla extract; I added 1 tablespoon of cornstarch, which adds even extra chewiness to the cookie; I refrigerated the dough for over four hours before baking (can be refrigerated even 24 hours before baking); I used a 1 tablespoon cookie scoop. The cookies were huge; chock-full of chocolate chips; crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. Simply the best.
We felt like there is too much flour in them, They are ‚Äúbig‚Äù inside but lacking taste. The cookies were too hard and crunchy for our taste.

I see some people gave this recipe one star. I think they must‚Äôve done something wrong. I made a double batch and substituted two of the cups of chocolate chips for one cup of Trader Joe‚Äôs. I haven‚Äôt made scratch cookies in 30 or 40 years. My wife usually does all the baking. She had one cookie and said she was giving up baking.
I love this recipe! i use sugar from trader joe's, king arthur baking flour, guittard chocolate chips and vanilla bean paste. they come out chewy and crunchy and delicious every time!

These are insanely good when made exactly as instructed. Definitely refrigerate the dough before baking to keep them from spreading too much. One thing I like to do occasionally is to brown the butter (gently melt it in a saucepan, stirring very frequently. Remove and cool once it‚Äôs beginning to turn brown). It adds a caramely richness that elevates them even further.

I've been making these cookies for the last few years and absolutely loved how they used to came out. It was perfection every time! BUT I just made them twice in the past couple of days and it's just not coming out the way it used to. I see that the recipe was updated last month (Nov 2022). I'd like to know what changed, because I loved how they came out before. Now when I'm done mixing in the dry ingredients, it doesn't have the thick consistency of cookie dough. I've had to chill the dough before baking. (Image is of cookies baked in 2020, the cookies now are coming out a lot flatter).
I've been making these cookies for 15 years now. My 3 kids (now 24, 19 and 15) request them/fight over them every single year! Lol! I've tried several other recipes and nothing tops this one.!!
Not a good idea to melt the butter. The cookies turned out hard.
This has been my holiday go to for about 6 years now and everyone loves them and expected them during this season.

Added a tiny bit of kosher salt to the top before baking. Used dark brown sugar and subbed Bobs red mill gluten free flour. Used salted butter and reduced the salt by 1/4 tsp because of the salty butter. These were amazing and everyone kept raving about them. I‚Äôm still getting requests for the recipe days later!!! These are by far THE BEST!!!
The best cookies I‚Äôve ever made. I was supposed to give them away for my friends and teachers, ending up eating them. The only thing I ended changing was using baking powder instead of baking soda.
yum yum

I'm used to cookie recipes required the dough to be refrigerated and having high oven temperatures so this was a bit new for me, and WOW they turned out amazing! I love chewy flat cookies and this is an excellent recipe for that style of cookie. I experimented with different sized drops on the cookie sheet, but my 1 tablespoon scoop made the perfect smap round cookies that you can easily eat 2 or 3 of! I had salted caramel chips I wanted to try so I did 2/3 cup of those and 1 1/3 cut semisweet chocolate chips and they came out great! I absolutely will be using this recipe again and highly recommend it!
Came out great

Followed the recipe exactly as stated. Except, I added Reece‚Äôs pieces and it was a hit with my family! I‚Äôm actually doing a bake sale to fundraise funds to support my class event, and I plan to use this recipe for one of the goodies I plan to bring. Such a easy, simple recipe!
Best cookie recipe I've made. Simple recipe, great flavor, and soft, chewy texture. Don't over bake because they become tough to chew.

I simply wanted to report that these cookies had an incredible flavor, and that the recipe was fantastic. So I signed up for an account. It turned out wonderful despite the fact that I only used one jumbo egg rather than one egg and one yolk. Because of the extent to which and the speed with which the batter melted, I was pretty worried after the oven had been on for a few minutes, but in the end, everything turned out perfectly great. Due to the fact that they spread so much during baking, it is highly recommended to scoop them using a 1/4 cup and to only put six on each baking sheet.
The perfect chocolate chip cookie...every single time! Follow the directions, nothing needs to be changed.

Easy to prep and came out lovely! I literally put the dough into a 1/4 cup, tapped it out onto the pan, and they baked into nice large cookies without flattening too much. I did 6 cookies at a time. No cookies touched the other cookies. Tastes just right as well.
Absolutely delicious!!
It was good not the best
There's too much butter they were greasy
Awesome chocolate chip recipe. Cookies were soft and chewy. Easy to make.
These are the best chocolate chip cookies. I‚Äôve made these a few times and every time they‚Äôre a hit!!
Favorite recipe for chocolate chip cookies. Have been taken to many potlucks and are always a hit. We like to add M&Ms for the specific holidays. A keeper, only recipe for us.
Easy to make and delicious!
Great recipe! Thank you. I added some walnuts and decreased amount of chocolate drops. Yummy!

They turned out so soft and chewy and stay that way until they are all gone, and the fact that they are hand size they last awhile. My whole family loved them, even my very picky autistic 2 yr old who refuses cake half the time. I'm actually leaving this comment while making them for the second time. This recipe is definitely going to be my go to for years to come
Best chewy chocolate chips ever! No changes to recipe
This is a great recipe, I‚Äôll definitely make them again, yummm üòã

These were so amazing! I forgot to save them on my phone and when I wanted to make them again I panicked when I couldn't find the recipe in my bookmarks. I went back and searched my history just to find this recipe again!! I have it saved forever now ;)
Best Chewy Chocolate chip cookie I've ever made! My go to recipe for chocolate chip cookies

This is my all time favorite cookie recipe. I use it whenever I have an event or just for a snack with the family. Due to the large size of the cookies, it takes little time to put them on a cookie sheet and set the timer! The recipe uses readily available ingredients, takes a few minutes to put together, and the result is AMAZING - a big, soft, delicious cookie from beginning to end! I like substituting milk chocolate chips in this recipe, but like them with either kind of chocolate.

I made this recipe because the melted butter part really intrigued me and to my surprise the recipe resulted in a delicious cookie. To make I subbed gluten free all purpose flour for regular with no issues other than baking a couple extra minutes. I did chill the dough in the fridge between batches. The resulting cookie was a perfect chocolate chip cookie that my family enjoyed and is definitely something i'd make again if I needed cookies and was short on time.

These were excellent. Rarely do I make chocolate chip cookies from scratch. My sons attacked the dough and my oldest instantly started talking about no more store bought dough. He'd help me make these again if I'd cook them. Once they were cooked, over half were gone the first night (and only 3 of us ate more than 1!) I used the exact measurements listed and managed to make 28 cookies. I thought I measured correctly but maybe it was slightly off. It did not affect them at all, it gave us more to eat! They have a delicious, crunchy other texture and are very creamy inside with all the chocolate. Excellent recipe!

This is by far, the best Chocolate Chip Cookie recipe Ever! In 2020 I made them weekly with my 3 year old Granddaughter at the time. Tomorrow is also a big day. I have 2 daughters, Spouses and went from 1 granddaughter to 5 in 2020. Tomorrow my additional Chefs will be 1-five year old, 2-two year old twin boys, 2-one year old twins boy and girl! We are making Beautiful Memories ‚ù§Ô∏è Thank you!
I never remember to review recipes but this one is so perfect I had to. They turned out so fat and soft!
I added 1 cup of Heath and 1 cup of walnuts. Just perfect!!

This is a great recipe to make with your kids. I loved the fact that you get to use melted butter instead of room temperature butter, sometimes you don‚Äôt get the time to plan for baking specially if you are trying to keep your children entertained. I followed the recipe to the tick, left the cookies in the oven for 19 minutes and they came out beautifully, chunky and chewy. I got 12 cookies out in total. We enjoyed them with a nice, cold glass of milk. This recipe is a keeper by all means and my daughter who is going to college next year asked me for the recipe so she can make them while she‚Äôs away.
These were okay. Not big, fat and chewy as the title suggests. I will stick with the recipe on the chocolate chip package.
These were beautiful. But there is something missing. I am not sure yet what it is. I am going to increase the vanilla and double the salt and see what happens.
These cookies are perfect! Soft and chewy! I made them with half swerve sugar substitute and half Splenda brown sugar substitute. Delicious!

If using melted butter like the recipe calls for then you HAVE to chill the dough!!!! Otherwise the shape will flatten in the oven and the cookie will NOT be thick! I learned this the first time making these, I‚Äôve made these about once a month for over a year now and they‚Äôre always requested again and again!!! 10/10 recipe as long as you chill the dough!!! I either put it in the fridge overnight or put it in the freezer for a couple of hours.
One of the best recipes!! They are delicious!

I only had granulated coconut sugar, not regular. I also mistakenly added the egg white vs the egg yolk (don't know where my mind was). I then had to up the cooking time to 30 minutes at 325, but it still came out delicious! Can't wait to try it again the correct way.
This has been our favorite chocolate chip recipe in our family for years!! Our go to, (almost only) that we make!
Yummy chewiness! I cut sugar in half, I‚Äôm sweet enough. I cut up Presidents Choice milk chocolate bars made in France
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!
Kid approved! My kiddos and friends said they were AMAZING!
These cookies are one of the best things I've ever tasted! Very easy to make. I was a little less than half a cup shy of chocolate chips and they were still delicious. Highly recommend this recipe.
When they said Big,fat, and chewy it was so meant. So appreciated this recipe.
was amazing to bake and eat with the fam, gran and gramps loved them made with love by the kids. everyday our kids wanted one as a snack üòÇ will 100% make these again and join in next time!! üíï
Easy recipe and scrumptious cookies!

These cookies are the best cookies we've ever had! I've cooked them a few different ways and they always come out PERFECT! It does call for a LOT of chips, but I managed it to the best of my ability. The last batch I made were these giant chewy ones. The boys LOVED them! Thanks for giving me this recipe.

I forgot to refrigerate the dough before baking, but they still turned out good. I made these for my mom's colleagues. They turned out nice and fat. Keep them in an airtight container or cake storage container to keep them moist.
I have made these cookies a number of times, they always turn out perfectly and loved by everyone.
They‚Äôre pretty good but it feels like something‚Äôs missing.
Added a teaspoon of salt and let it rest in the fridge for an hour prior to baking.
Love it

This was the best chocolate chip cookie recipe ever! I did 2 changes. I only used 1/4 tsp salt and did 1 cup of semisweet chips and 1 cup milk chocolate chips. I made the dough 1 day and baked them the next. I left the dough out to soften for 30 minutes. I used a melon baller to scoop the dough out and they came out all the same size. I baked them for 16 minutes and left them on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before removing them. They cooked up nice and plump and didn‚Äôt spread out, just a perfectly round cookie. I quadrupled the recipe and put balls of the cookie dough in the freezer for future use. I gave a gallon size of cookie dough balls plus a gallon of baked cookies to my best friend. I put my baked cookies in a freezer bag and they were still soft after a week. This recipe beats the original Toll House recipe hands down!!!
Absolutely my favorite recipe for chocolate chip cookies! Every time I make them I usually give some to coworkers and family they are usually gone in a flash.
Great, chewy consistency and bakery-like, as promised. My one criticism is that there was too much vanilla. I would cut it back to 1 tsp next time.
I doubles the recipe, awesome cookies, Next time though I will cut back on the chocolate chips,
So good even my dog wants it‚Ä¶ but then again my dog will eat anything and everything.
They came out great! I made little cookies for my Gran babies, cooked for 12 minutes on a cookie mat.

item.name: Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie
